1499875154838626314.text: As a member of the Senate Committee on Veterans’ Affairs, I’ll fight like hell to make sure veterans in South Dakota receive the care they’ve earned. I call upon all veterans organizations to help us defend these services in rural South Dakota.

1499875153462931459.text: The VA MISSION Act was bad public policy then and it’s gotten no better with age. While the provisions of this BRAC will not be released publicly until March 14th – the threat has become clear to our local veterans.

1499875151986495491.text: The VA MISSION Act also included provisions to include this BRAC-style process, which we learned today will negatively impact much of rural SD.

1499875150350671875.text: The concerns I warned against in 2018 when I voted against the VA MISSION Act have come to fruition. Veterans were told they could receive care in the community, and that’s proven not to be the case.

1398003858874503168.text: There are many interesting moves being made in the field of CCs. It very much is the Wild West of finance. They make new things possible, which isn’t always a good thing. They can have consequences no one expected. This field deserves a great deal of attention going forward.

1398003857473556484.text: So how does this relate to Colonial Pipeline? Bitcoins only exist as data. They can be tied to digital wallets rather than a specific person’s identity, which means people believe they can receive and spend them anonymously- perfect for secret transactions like ransoms.

1398003856076939272.text: This means that, as bitcoin gets more valuable, more people mine, mining gets harder, it takes more computations and more electricity to mine a bitcoin. Some of you may be familiar with @elonmusk recent statement about bitcoin’s carbon footprint.

1398003854676008964.text: In short, the more miners there are, the harder it is to mine bitcoins. Since the best way to mine is to simply use more computations, there is an incentive to pool as much effort into mining as possible, simply to make sure your pool has an advantage over other miners.

1398003853312811008.text: The interesting thing is that you can make it easier or harder to form new blocks if you make the nonce higher or lower. And for bitcoin, the difficulty is adjusted every 2016 blocks so that the rate of formation of new blocks is constant.

1398003851882545154.text: Despite the randomness, it's more like they’re getting paid a fee to maintain ledgers than mining or creating bitcoins. Miners provide proof that they’ve done work to contribute to the chain in exchange for compensation (in bitcoins), rather than making bitcoins themselves.

1398003850464960516.text: The first person to win a block gets a prize of bitcoins. Since the second step in forming a block is essentially up to chance, the most effective way to mine is simply to throw more computation at the problem, verifying as many blocks as possible as fast as possible.

1398003848980144128.text: You may ask “why not just guess 000…0001 for your hash, if the goal is to get a hash below the target nonce?” The answer: your guess is put through what is basically a randomizing equation based on several inputs, like the timestamp. Guessing your hash ahead of time is #noncense

1398003846924976133.text: In short, mining a new bitcoin is a two-step process. First, you need to verify a block’s worth of transactions, then you need to guess a hash (a number). Your guess is compared to a target (called a nonce) and if your guess is below the nonce then you form a block.

1398003845532356614.text: Since #bitcoins are decentralized, there isn’t a government or bank to maintain the system, which means there needs to be a different way. People who verify transactions are bitcoin miners, and the process of verification is fundamental to how they make (or mine) new bitcoins.

1398003844181803009.text: These protocols revolve around cryptography (for computers, this is the use of math to code information) hence “crypto”currencies. However, someone needs to actually verify each new block in the chain to keep the system running smoothly.

1398003842793545728.text: This blockchain of transactions forms a distributed ledger that is difficult to modify and easy to verify (in theory); a ledger that is maintained collectively on a network with specific protocols to verify each new block in the chain, meaning that bitcoin exchanges are secure.

1398003841434636297.text: Using bitcoin as an example: bitcoins exist in digital ledgers, but to prevent fraudulent exchanges, transactions are recorded in encrypted blocks. Each block points at the previous block and has a timestamp. Go where each block points and you get a chain, called a “blockchain”.

1398003840042078212.text: The software used to make new CCs exists and is publicly available, which means that developing a new CC can be done in as little as a few hours. Honestly, it looks like a return to the days when each bank printed their own notes.

1398003838678974474.text: CCs exist only in digital ledgers and wallets rather than as physical objects like dollar bills. Like all fiat currencies, they have value only because people agree they do, but CCs in general lack the backing of a government or central bank.

1398003837240287232.text: Some people decided that, if the commodity backing a currency doesn’t matter, then why should money need to be a physical object and why should you need a government (or bank) to back money? From there, some programmers started developing cryptocurrencies (CCs).

1398003835864498183.text: Some history: in the last century governments have moved away from commodity currencies (such as gold) to fiat currencies (such as Federal Reserve notes) cementing the idea that money can have value just because people agree it does.

1398003834069336066.text: Software developments, however, mean that they don’t need to bother with masks and voice modulators. They can issue a ransom and request payment with a cryptocurrency (CC) (like bitcoin) rather than exchange a briefcase full of cash.

1398003832622358532.text: Hostage and ransom payments are a practice that has been applied in different contexts for thousands of years, ranging from prisoner exchanges to kidnappings. Today, a person collecting a ransom payment does not want their identity publicly tied to a ransom.

1398003831087190021.text: Thread: Recently, I tweeted about the Colonial Pipeline ransomware attack. Since then, the Colonial Pipeline network has returned to normal operations, but I realize that there was one question I didn’t answer. Specifically: how do ransomware ransoms get paid?

1392241032264359937.text: Silence only helps bad actors. Sharing info about attacks, exploits or vulnerabilities allows us to find trends in attacks, share effective responses, and respond effectively to the fast-pace and evolving threat of cyberattack.

1392241031370973187.text:
In this rapidly evolving environment the federal government has a role to play. To start, 
@CISAgov has tools and resources available to help protect networks (https://t.co/FSv3GxbcAv) and implement best practices (https://t.co/tYjp1gMokV)

1392241030636969984.text: Citizens, companies, and even local and state governments are vulnerable to cyberattacks and need to be prepared in advance to deal with them.

1392241029844291588.text: Ransomware has been on the rise for a long time, but increases in teleworking have exposed existing cyber vulnerabilities in many companies’ systems. We see from Colonial Pipeline that such vulnerabilities can impact even the largest companies.

1392241029097607175.text: Ransomware is malware that infects a computer system and locks it down, preventing it from working. It holds the system “hostage” until a ransom is paid. Pipelines aren’t unique; ransomware can target digital records, ordinary servers or even traffic lights.

1392241028309164033.text: The first is the rise of ransomware attacks, the second (which I plan to discuss more at a later date) is the vulnerability of critical infrastructure.

1392241027549958148.text: While not a replacement for Colonial Pipeline’s full network, this waiver and several smaller lines that are in operation should buy time to restore full function. This incident illustrates two problems at once.

1392241026753048578.text: The attack has caused shutdowns across their network, a problem that is exacerbated by rising demand for fuel as the economy recovers. To help combat supply issues, the Department of Transportation issued a temporary waiver to ease trucking of oil products to impacted areas.

1392241025998069760.text: Thread: You may have seen the news this weekend about the ransomware attack on Colonial Pipeline, which is responsible for providing ~45% of the East Coast’s supply of diesel, petrol and jet fuel.

1260693607482298369.text: It started with a bad FISA warrant when, according to the IG at the DOJ, FBI employees made substantial misrepresentations to the affidavits they submitted to the court in order to get approval to surveil the Trump campaign. 1260693606681190405.text: The FBI’s gross mishandling of the FISA process when it surveilled President Trump’s campaign has underscored the need to reform the entire process.

1260693604407881734.text: I just voted in favor of the Lee/Leahy amendment to the FISA reform bill. This amendment provides federal law enforcement with the tools they need to protect Americans from foreign powers while also better protecting the civil liberties of all Americans.

1149689686476099586.text: I’ll continue to work in the Senate to support patient-centered, market-based reforms that are truly affordable.

1149689683980558336.text: Every American deserves access to quality, affordable health care coverage, but Obamacare is not the answer, nor is socialized medicine run by the government.

1149689682453827584.text: Earlier this year, I introduced with Senator @MartinHeinrich the Middle Class Health Benefits Tax Repeal Act, to permanently repeal this tax. Our legislation has bipartisan support from more than 40 cosponsors who are working hard to advance it in the Senate.

1149689680969048064.text: I've also been working to provide SD families with relief from Obamacare. This includes repealing the Cadillac Tax: a 40% tax on health coverage that exceeds predetermined amounts. This tax, if implemented, would affect nearly 450,000 SD'ans with employer-sponsored health care.

1149689679463243776.text: While we continue our work to repeal & replace Obamacare, we’re committed to making sure pre-existing conditions are protected for individuals that maintain continuous coverage, the guaranteed renewal of coverage and allowing children to remain on their parents’ plans until 26.

1149689678465044488.text: We also had 17 different providers offering group health insurance before Obamacare. Today, we have just two.

1149689677257027585.text: In South Dakota, we had guaranteed renewability and guaranteed portability before Obamacare came along. We also allowed children in school to stay on their parents’ insurance until the age of 29. Under Obamacare, it went down to 26.

1149689676363685888.text: Let’s set the record straight: Obamacare has been a disaster from the start for millions of people who were forced off the health care plans they liked & who now pay higher & higher premiums each month, while having fewer plans to choose from as providers leave the marketplace.

1149689675529052160.text: This week, the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals heard arguments in a lawsuit seeking to overturn Obamacare. 1100772836665450498.text: We can't afford to wait any longer to take steps to get our debt under control. This includes committing to regular order with regard to our budget process & managing the entire federal budget, including mandatory payments. Delaying action & looking the other way is not an option

1100772835293839362.text: In SD, we balance our books each year, and we have a strong economy and low unemployment because of it. High debt threatens economic growth by driving up interest rates and discouraging businesses and individuals from investing back into the economy.

1100772833767186433.text: Joined @sendavidperdue @SenJoniErnst @JerryMoran @SenatorLankford to introduce a resolution recognizing U.S debt as a threat to our national security. 1096108197759332354.text: We must take steps to immediately address the shortcomings of the IHS that failed the victims outlined in the WSJ/FRONTLINE investigation, and so many other tribal members for far too long.

1096108196299722752.text: An assessment will allow us to take a close look at the failures of the IHS so that we can work in close consultation with the tribes to immediately solve these problems and begin providing the reliable care our tribal members deserve.

1096108194823323648.text: IHS has a trust & treaty responsibility to provide proper health care to tribal members. More on my bill here: https://t.co/jAEUPE7unt

1096108193711906825.text: This news reinforces the need for my IHS assessment legislation, which I reintroduced today. Tribal members have faced unimaginable horrors because IHS has failed to meet basic benchmarks for providing timely, adequate care.

1088897485966397445.text: Government shutdowns and continuing resolutions are wasteful, ineffective and destabilize government programs, making them more difficult for our citizens to utilize.

1088897483642732544.text:
Congress and the president must now work diligently on a long-term appropriations package and strengthening border security. The
senselessness of the past 35 days, coupled with another short-term CR,
underscores the need to reform the entire budget process.

1068595339949678593.text: The EPA should be using their legal authority to not only restore these lost gallons, but anticipate their impact moving forward. These waivers have the potential to reduce domestic corn ethanol demand by billions of gallons, hurting SD farmers & our state’s largest industry.

1068595338515292161.text: However, I am disappointed that the EPA did not incorporate the impact of small refinery waivers into their decision. The EPA granting these waivers has lowered the amount of corn ethanol blended into the nation’s fuel supply in recent years.

1068595336879452160.text: The explosion of corn ethanol production has directly helped our farmers, bolstered American energy independence & created thousands of jobs. Pleased to see @EPA meet their statutory deadline with this rulemaking & that they are allowing for 15B gallons of corn ethanol in '19.

1032024528250171394.text: Appreciated the opportunity to sit down with EPA Acting Administrator Andrew Wheeler today to talk about a number of issues, including year-round sales of E15, my concerns w/ small refinery waivers & the proposed rewrite of the Clean Power Plan. https://t.co/w7BvmUnjBi https://t.co/mxf2tZf2DL

1031966142389256195.text: I support the current administration’s goal of providing affordable energy to South Dakota families while at the same time working to protect our environment and natural resources. https://t.co/XILFUsb96V

1031966140900225024.text: We were glad to see the CPP rule was halted by the Supreme Court after more than two dozen states called for it to be stopped. The new proposed Affordable Clean Energy rule respects the rights of individual states in setting energy policies that work best for them.

1031966139063169025.text: The previous administration’s costly and burdensome Clean Power Plan was a prime example of ‘government-knows-best’ rule-making. Not only did it threaten job creation and economic growth, it was a recipe for sky-high electricity costs for American families and businesses.

1008838511074693126.text: As chairman of the Cybersecurity Subcommittee I’m glad we were able to adopt a number of important cyber measures in the #NDAA. One of the most vital is a provision that will allow the DoD expanded authority to conduct cyber operations needed to help keep America safe.

1008838509602492417.text: It also includes a provision I offered to help military members transition into civilian life. Our unemployment rate is the lowest it has been in nearly 2 decades & this will help promote military members’ talents to employers across the country.

1008838508163817472.text: #NDAA includes a provision I offered that would require DoD to report the number of eligible military members able to participate in the Transition Assistance Program following their service.

1008838506704199681.text: The #NDAA authorizes $716 billion in defense spending, prohibits a BRAC round & provides a 2.6% pay raise to military members.

1008838505236189184.text: The #NDAA is named in honor of Chairman John McCain. Few people are more passionate about our troops & our military readiness than @SenJohnMcCain . The courage he has exhibited during his years of service - and in his current battle – has inspired us all.

1008838503684296705.text: This year’s #NDAA builds on last year’s efforts to provide tools to our armed forces so they can fully rebuild our military & address the challenges we’re facing.

999043667351490560.text: The economic growth legislation includes seven of my provisions, incl. one to protect the credit of veterans, rural appraisal relief, and my Home Mortgage Disclosure Adjustment Act. Details: https://t.co/FfqPkGMOG9

999043666357510145.text: I am an original cosponsor of the Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief and Consumer Protection Act, which now heads to the president’s desk to be signed into law.

999043664621064192.text: The House just passed our economic growth bill that will provide much-needed regulatory relief for small-and-medium-sized banks and credit unions. This will allow them to focus on serving their customers, rather than complying with onerous, burdensome regulations.

998955957014102016.text: Lastly, we were able to secure a verbal commitment from the Chairman to work with us to fix an Obama-era proposal known as the ‘surplus water rule,’ which restricts South Dakotans’ access to water in Corps-controlled land. South Dakotans are legally entitled to use the water.

998955954094960646.text: We were also able to secure a provision for the Corps to carry out a project for shoreline stabilization on the Lower Brule Reservation. This much-needed project will help fix erosion that is threatening an entire community and the surrounding environment.

998955951687372800.text: It prioritizes implementation of the Upper Missouri River Basin snowpack monitoring program that I’ve been calling for since taking office. This program will help mitigate the possibility of a flood event for those living near the Missouri River.

998955949309284352.text: Includes language to update & maintain water infrastructure systems such as dams and levees, upgrade drinking and waste water systems and increase water storage to make certain all citizens have access to safe, clean water.

977262000840507392.text: The omnibus gives a 2.4 percent pay raise to our hardworking men and women in uniform – the largest pay increase for our troops in nearly a decade.

928373847405056001.text: WATCH: opening remarks at @IndianCommittee earlier today in support of my IHS assessment legislation. https://t.co/QTx3Hvb0Nh https://t.co/789bSgqSOm

928353036262629376.text: My bill, S. 465, would set us on a path to address the long standing failures of IHS. https://t.co/YxUD61DVL0

928352794477768704.text: I believe that a comprehensive assessment of IHS is a necessary first step toward making calculated and systematic changes at IHS.

928352688089305088.text: For many in my home state and across the country, fixing the broken IHS is literally a matter of life and death.

928352507885170688.text: IHS will continue to fail unless we take a close look into the operations, funding, quality of care, and management at IHS.

928352390436327424.text: While many believe that IHS is underfunded, from my standpoint, investing more taxpayer money into a dysfunctional system will only compound the problem. IHS lacks an efficient system and accountability; this needs to be addressed before we consider funding.

928352263017463808.text: For years, tribal members in South Dakota have dealt with unimaginable horrors in dealing with IHS facilities.
